numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young people are generally more optimistic than elderly people.
2. Rapid development happened in recent years.
3. Rapid development could be a reason for the optimism of young people.
4. Some people are between 15 years and 24 years old.
5. Many people between 15 years and 24 years old were born around 2000.
6. Many people between 15 years and 24 years old experienced an extreme pace of development.
7. Fifteen years ago, most people used simple phones.
8. A simple phone had only a communication function.
9. Now many people use smartphones.
10. Some smartphones are iPhones.
11. Some smartphones are Huawei phones.
12. Some smartphones are Samsung phones.
13. A smartphone has many different functions.
14. Smartphones bring convenience to people's lives.
15. A smartphone can connect people all over the world.
16. A smartphone can let people share their lives.
17. A smartphone can let people play games.
18. A smartphone can let people watch videos.
19. People can do these things at any time.
20. People can do these things anywhere.
21. Some young people cannot imagine life before the popularity of the Internet and smartphones.
22. This could be a big reason for this phenomenon.
23. A survey has 21000 people.
24. A survey with 21000 people is relatively small.
25. Some people are aged between 25 years and 40 years.
26. The survey neglects people aged between 25 years and 40 years.
27. People aged between 25 years and 40 years should have the right to express their thoughts.
28. People in my country did not participate in this survey.
29. I live in my country.
30. An intelligent society brings great convenience to me.
31. I do not want to give up this change.
32. I do not want to imagine how inconvenient life was 20 years ago.
33. I do not want to imagine how inconvenient life was 30 years ago.
34. The headline is: Optimistic About the Future?
